intro: Gaudichaudia mollis, commonly known as the soft gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, hairy leaves that are typically gray-green in color, and it produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. Gaudichaudia mollis is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
